properties.title: Makkah
properties.name: Makkah
properties.popupContent: The Holy City Mecca, Where Ka`ba-tul-Allah is located and the Prophet Muhammad S.A.W was born.

properties.name: Banu Sa'd Countryside
properties.title: House of Bibi Halimah رضي الله عنها
properties.popupContent: These are said to be the ruins of Banu Sa’d Village where the house of Bibi Halimah رضي الله عنها was located. Hz. Prophet Muhammad ﷺ spent some years of his childhood here.  The Banu Sa’d was one of the leading royal tribes of Arabia during the Hz. Prophet Muhammad’s ﷺ era.  They were great warriors and fought many battles with Prophet Muhammad ﷺ against enemies of Islam.  Bibi Halima Sadia رضي الله عنها, Hz. Prophet Muhammad’s ﷺ wet nurse, belonged to this tribe. They migrated on the order of Prophet Muhammad ﷺ to Subcontinent, Africa and Europe to fight against Polytheism.

events.title: THE PROPHET’S ﷺ CHEST IS SPLIT OPEN

properties.name: Al-Abwa near the territory of the tribe of al-Naabighah
properties.title: Al-Abwa
properties.popupContent: Al-Abwā' is a Hejazi village between Mecca and Medina belonging to the area of Rabigh, on the western coast of Saudi Arabia. The place where the mother of Hazrat Muhammad ﷺ, Aminah bint Wahb ibn Abd Manaf, died.

events.title: THE DEATH OF THE MOTHER OF THE PROPHET ﷺ AAMINAH BINT WAHB, AND SUCKLING AT THE HANDS OF UMM AYMAN, HIS WET NURSE
events.location: Between Mecca and Medina (near the territory of the tribe of al-Naabighah)

properties.name: Busra
properties.title: Busra
properties.popupContent: This Structure is believed to be the monastery of Bahira the monk, who prophesied about Hz. Prophet Muhammad ﷺ in his childhood  The Monastery of Bahira is one of the most significant Muslim sites in this area.

events.title: THE PROPHET’S ﷺ JOURNEY TO AL-SHAAM AND THE MONK BAHEERA
The Prophet Muhammad ﷺ's Second Journey to Syria

properties.name: Cave of Hira (Jabl an-Nur)
properties.title: Cave of Hira (Jabl an-Nur)
properties.popupContent: The mountain houses the grotto or cave of Hira, which holds tremendous significance for Muslims throughout the world, as the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ is said to have spent a great deal of time in this cave meditating, and it is widely believed that it was here that He ﷺ received his first revelation, which consisted of the first five ayats of Surah Al-Alaq from the angel Hz. Jibra’il عليه اسلام

events.title: The First Revelation and the Prophethood of the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ

properties.name: Jabal Thawr
properties.title: Jabal Thawr
properties.popupContent: Jabal Thawr is located south of Mecca and Masjid al-Haram, on road to Yemen. Height of the mountain is 1,405 m.  The fame of this mountain is because of the cave where Hz. Prophet Muhammad ﷺ at the beginning of Hijra (the Immigration) in Laylat al-Mabit sought shelter there from the polytheists.

properties.name: Adulis
properties.title: Adulis
properties.popupContent: The Ancient Adulis (Modern Day Ruins found in Zula)

properties.name: Aksum
properties.popupContent: Aksum now a small town, once used to be the capital of Abyssinia (The Kingdom of Aksum)

properties.name: First Hijrah Route
properties.popupContent: Ibn Sa'ad, in his Kitab Tabqaat al-Kubra, briefly mentions the route taken by the Muslim migrants. Ibn Sa'ad says on the authority of Harith ibn al-Fudail that the group boarded one of the two merchant ships from Shuaiba (Yaqut says it was the place where ships (marfa') used to beach for Mecca in the days before Jidda became its port), and paid half Dinar (دينار) each for faring them across the sea.
References: Ibn Sa'ad, Kitab Tabqat al-Kubra, Volume 1, Parts 1.50.1-3.
Hussein Ahmed Ethiopian Muslims and Islam: Journal of Ethiopian Studies, vol. XXXVII, no. 2, Addis Ababa 2004.

properties.name: The Prophet's house
properties.popupContent:
The Prophet's house is surrounded at night by the Quraysh intent on assassinating him. He recited Yasin and stepped out the house and by the aid of Allah walked passed them unseen. He headed to the house of Abu Bakr Siddiq.

Location (AHK p.51): The Prophet used to live here with Umm Muminin Khadijah. It is 309m NE from the Ka'ba.

Date: Thur, 1 Rabi I, 1 AH / 15 Sept, 622 CE

properties.name: The House of Abu Bakr Siddiq
properties.popupContent:
Having evaded the assassination squad, the Prophet arrived at Abu Bakr Siddiq's house at night. They had made travel preparations two months before. The Prophet and Abu Bakr headed south towards Ghar Thawr to avoid.

LOC (AHK p. 53): The house was located in the Banu Jumah neighbourhood. Today it is in the Abraj Makkah (The clock Tower complex). The is a mosque on the place of his house called Masjid Abu Bakr. It 435m SSW from the Ka'bah.

Date: Thur, 1 Rabi I, 3 AH / 15 Sept, 622 CE

properties.name: Ghar Thawr
properties.popupContent:
The Prophet and Siddiq evading the hunting party headed south at night and hid in a cave in Mount Thawr. They stayed inside there for three days despite the danger of snakes and scorpions. A search party did arrive but by the aid of Allah they remained unseen.

LOC (AHK p.56): The house was located in the Banu Jumah neighbourhood. Today it is in the Abraj Makkah (The clock Tower complex). The is a mosque on the place of his house called Masjid Abu Bakr. It 5600m SSE from the Ka'bah.

Arrival: Thur (N), 1 Rabi I, 1 AH / 15 Sept, 622 CE
Dept: Sun (N), 3 Rabi I,  1 AH / 15 Sept, 622 CE

Ref: Quran 9:40

properties.name: Lower Makkah
properties.popupContent:
The Prophet and Siddiq after spending all of Friday, Saturday and Sunday in cave, descended from the mountain at night and exited on the south west side of the mountain on foot. Then they started moving west towards the red sea. 

LOC (AHK p.57): It 6km SSE from the Ka'bah.

Date: Sun (N), 4 Rabi I, 1 AH / 18 Sept, 622 CE

properties.name: Hudaybiyyah
properties.popupContent: Date: Sun (N), 4 Rabi I, 1 AH / 18 Sept, 622 CE

properties.name: Asfal Usfan
properties.popupContent:
Location (AKH p. 61): 78 km NW from the Kaba.

Date: Tru, 6 Rabi I, 1 AH / 20 Sept, 622 CE

properties.name: Hijrah to Madinah - Day 0 - Fri - Sun
